McVay |city = [[College Place, Washington|College Place]] |state = [[Washington (U.S. state)|WA]] |country = [[United States|USA]] |students = 1,791http://www.wallawalla.edu/about-wwu/an-introduction/fast-facts/ |undergrad = 1,549 |faculty = 207 |endowment = $13.98 millionhttp://colleges.usnews.rankingsandreviews.com/best-colleges/walla-walla-university-3799 |campus = [[Suburban]] |colors = [[Variations of green#Forest_green|Forest Green]] {{color box|#228B22}}
[[Sorbus aucuparia|Mountain Ash Orange-Red]] {{color box|#FF4500}} |nickname = [[Wolves]] |website = [http://www.wallawalla.edu wallawalla.edu] }} '''Walla Walla University''' is a University offering [[liberal arts]], professional, and technical programs located in [[College Place, Washington|College Place]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]], just a few miles from [[Walla Walla, Washington|Walla Walla]]. The current President is John McVay. It was founded in 1892 and is affiliated with the [[Seventh-day Adventist Church]]. The University has an annual enrollment of around 1,500 students.http://collegesearch.collegeboard.com/search/CollegeDetail.jsp?collegeId=1049 It is [[regional accreditation|regionally accredited]] by the [[Northwest Association of Schools and Colleges]] and is also [[Adventist Accrediting Association|denominationally accredited]]. Walla Walla offers 36 majors, seven masterâs degrees, and an associate of science degree. The Edward F. Cross School of Engineering is an [[Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology|ABET]] accredited program that offers bachelor of science and engineering degrees. No published research is regularly done at the school. Students are organized as the Associated Students of Walla Walla University or ASWWU. ASWWU operates the student newspaper ''The Collegian'', the annual ''Mountain Ash'' (a collection of photography, student art, and mugs), an online radio station, and the student directory the ''Mask''. Both the men's and the women's on-campus dormitories operate their own clubs. The women's club is named Aleph Gimel Ain (AGA); the men's club is named Omicron Pi Sigma (OPS). WWU also has a hockey team, "The Pack," which competes in the [[American Collegiate Hockey Association]]. ==Presidents== {{div col|3}} *[[W. W. Prescott|William Prescott]] (1892â1894) *Edward A. Sutherland (1894â1897) *Emmett J. Hibbard (1897â1898) *Walter R. Sutherland (1898â1900) *Edwin L. Stewart (1900â1902) *Charles C. Lewis (1902â1904) *Joseph L. Kay (1904â1905) *Marion E. Cady (1905â1911) *Ernest C. Kellogg (1911â1917) *Walter I. Smith (1917â1930) *John E. Weaver (1930â1933) *William M. Landeen (1933â1938) *George W. Bowers (1938â1955) *Percy W.
